a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: DALY rates from drug use disorders by age, World, 1990 to 2017
DALY (Disability-Adjusted Life Year) rates from drug use disorders by age, measured as the number of DALYs per
100,000 individuals. DALYs are used to measure total burden of disease - both from years of life lost and years
lived with a disability. One DALY equals one lost year of healthy life.
Source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease
